title: Estadio Bellavista
text:
Estadio Bellavista is a multi-use <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Ambato%2C%20Ecuador">Ambato</a>, <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>. It is used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches and is the home stadium of <a href="Mushuc%20Runa%20Sporting%20Club">Mushuc Runa</a>, <a href="Club%20Social%20y%20Deportivo%20Macar%C3%A1">Macará</a>, and <a href="Club%20Deportivo%20T%C3%A9cnico%20Universitario">Técnico Universitario</a>. The stadium holds 16,467 spectators and is located on Bolivariana Avenue, a main thoroughfare through the city of Ambato.
History.
The stadium was built in 1945 and inaugurated in July of the same year. The stadium was damaged by the <a href="1949%20Ambato%20earthquake">earthquake that hit Ambato on August 5, 1949</a>. It underwent a renovation and was reopened the next year. In 1993, Estadio Bellavista was one of the locations for <a href="Copa%20America%201993">Copa America</a> games. <a href="Ambato%2C%20Ecuador">Ambato</a> played host to <a href="Venezuela%20national%20football%20team">Venezuela</a>, <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a>, and <a href="Uruguay%20national%20football%20team">Uruguay</a>.
